title: Immunofluorescence of Cultured Cells
procedures:
1. Wash cells with PBS.
  2. Fix in 4% PFA for 15 min at room temperature \(RT).
  3. Wash cells with PBS \(2 x 5 min).  Cells can be stored in PBS at 4C for up to a week.
  4. Permeabilize with PBS + 0.1% TritonX-100 for 5 min at RT.
  5. Wash with PBS \(2 x 5 min) at RT.
  6. Block with 10% serum \(from species of secondary) for 1 hr at RT.
  7. Drain and incubate with primary antibody diluted in 5% serum overnight at 4C.
  8. Wash in PBS \(3 x 5 min) at RT. 
  9. Detect primary antibody with Alexa Fluor secondary antibody diluted 1:400 in 5% serum at RT for 1 hr in the dark.
  10. Wash in PBS \(3 x 5 min) at RT.
  11. Add mounting media with DAPI and apply coverslip.   
  12. Store slides in the dark at 4C.
